abstract.text: Measurements of Vector Boson production in association with jets are presented, using p-p collision data at √ s = 7 TeV.

The measurements presented include Z + jets azimuthal correlations, event shapes, vector boson + jets differential cross section measurements, hard double-parton scattering using W + jets events and electroweak Z + forward -backward jet production.

body_text.text: Introduction
Vector boson production is one of the best understood processes at hadron colliders.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Events of W and Z bosons decaying into electrons and muons are among the cleanest experimental final states.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Measurements of jet production associated with vector bosons provide a stringent test of perturbative QCD (pQCD).
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: These processes are sensitive to new physics effects, and are backgrounds for new physics and Higgs boson searches.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: These measurements can also provide constraints on Parton Distribution Functions (PDFs) and are used to improve the Monte Carlo generators.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: In this paper, various V + jets measurements carried out by the CMS experiment [1] are summarised.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Z + jets azimuthal correlations and event shape measurement
Measurement of azimuthal correlations and event shapes of Z + jets process is carried out by the CMS experiment [2].
body_text.section: Z + jets azimuthal correlations and event shape measurement

body_text.text: The measurement is made in two phase space regions; inclusive (transverse momentum, P T (Z) > 0 GeV) and boosted regimes (P T (Z) > 150 GeV).
body_text.section: Z + jets azimuthal correlations and event shape measurement

body_text.text: Boosted regime is of particular interest since it is important for new physics searches.
body_text.section: Z + jets azimuthal correlations and event shape measurement

body_text.text: Figure 1 and 2 show the P T distribution of di-muon candidates and the jet multiplicity associated with these events respectively.
body_text.section: Z + jets azimuthal correlations and event shape measurement

body_text.text: In Figures 3 and 4, the azimuthal angle difference between the leading jet and the Z boson are presented for inclusive and boosted regimes respectively.
body_text.section: Z + jets azimuthal correlations and event shape measurement

body_text.text: It is seen that the data is well described by the Monte Carlo.
body_text.section: Z + jets azimuthal correlations and event shape measurement

body_text.text: Measurement of Z + 1 jet and photon + 1 jet rapidity distributions
Presence of the electroweak vertex makes the perturbative QCD calculations stable.
body_text.section: Measurement of Z + 1 jet and photon + 1 jet rapidity distributions

body_text.text: Precise measurement of the rapidity in Z+jet events is required for Higgs boson measurements.
body_text.section: Measurement of Z + 1 jet and photon + 1 jet rapidity distributions

body_text.text: Measurement of rapidities in events with a vector boson (γ, Z) and a jet is performed [3].
body_text.section: Measurement of Z + 1 jet and photon + 1 jet rapidity distributions

body_text.section: Measurement of Z + 1 jet and photon + 1 jet rapidity distributions

body_text.text: Detector level exclusive jet multiplicity for the di-muon events, after detector efficiency corrections applied.
body_text.section: Measurement of Z + 1 jet and photon + 1 jet rapidity distributions

body_text.text: Figure 3.
body_text.section: Measurement of Z + 1 jet and photon + 1 jet rapidity distributions

body_text.text: Azimuthal angle difference between the Z boson and the leading jet in the inclusive 3 jet multiplicity Δφ(Z, j 1 ) without any requirements on   vector boson and the jet rapidities, the rapidity difference (y di f = |y V − y jet |/2), and the rapidity sum (y sum = |y V + y jet |/2) is carried out.
body_text.section: Measurement of Z + 1 jet and photon + 1 jet rapidity distributions

body_text.text: Here y sum is related to the boost from laboratory frame to the centre of mass frame of the V+jet system.
body_text.section: Measurement of Z + 1 jet and photon + 1 jet rapidity distributions

body_text.text: The quantities y sum and y di f f are uncorrelated observables, whereas y Z and y jet are highly correlated.
body_text.section: Measurement of Z + 1 jet and photon + 1 jet rapidity distributions

body_text.text: The rapidity sum, y sum is mainly dependent on the PDFs, whereas y di f f is sensitive to Leading Order (LO) partonic differential cross sections.
body_text.section: Measurement of Z + 1 jet and photon + 1 jet rapidity distributions

body_text.text: Figures 5 -6 show y Z and y jet distributions for Z + jet events.
body_text.section: Measurement of Z + 1 jet and photon + 1 jet rapidity distributions

body_text.text: Vector boson and jet rapidity distributions are shown to be consistent with the perturbative QCD predictions, while y sum and y di f f distributions show discrepancies between QCD predictions and data.
body_text.section: Measurement of Z + 1 jet and photon + 1 jet rapidity distributions

body_text.text: The calculations at the Next to Leading Order (NLO) QCD, and simulations using two different Matrix Element to Parton Shower matching methods fail to describe data and are inconsistent among each other.
body_text.section: Measurement of Z + 1 jet and photon + 1 jet rapidity distributions

body_text.text: Photon+jets differential cross section measurement
Measurements of photon production with one or more jets (γ + jets) provide a stringent test of pQCD.
body_text.section: Photon+jets differential cross section measurement

body_text.text: The production cross sections of γ + jets for various angular configurations are strongly dependent on QCD hard-scattering sub-processes.
body_text.section: Photon+jets differential cross section measurement

body_text.text: These processes are also directly sensitive to the gluon PDFs in ICNFP 2013 00016-p.3  the proton, hence may provide constraints on the PDFs.
body_text.section: Photon+jets differential cross section measurement

body_text.text: These measurements provide tests of fixed order pQCD calculations in a wide range of kinematic phase space.
body_text.section: Photon+jets differential cross section measurement

body_text.text: Triple differential cross section of γ + jet processes, d 3 σ/dp γ T dη γ dη jet , is measured [4] as well as ratios of the cross sections with respect to different jet-photon orientations are measured, where some of the main uncertainties cancel.
body_text.section: Photon+jets differential cross section measurement

body_text.text: The cross section distributions are displayed in Figures 7 and 8.
body_text.section: Photon+jets differential cross section measurement

body_text.text: The results show that the NLO predictions describes the data well, whereas LO predictions underestimate the data.
body_text.section: Photon+jets differential cross section measurement

body_text.text: Di-jet mass spectrum measurement in W + 2 jets
CDF Collaboration reported an excess in invariant mass (M JJ ) constructed from the two highest transverse momentum jets in events with W boson and two jets in the mass range 120 -160 GeV [5].
body_text.section: Di-jet mass spectrum measurement in W + 2 jets

body_text.text: The cross section of excess is determined to be 4 pb.
body_text.section: Di-jet mass spectrum measurement in W + 2 jets

body_text.text: A similar search is carried out by the D0 collaboration and an upper limit of 1.9 pb is set on the cross section at 95 % CL [6].
body_text.section: Di-jet mass spectrum measurement in W + 2 jets

body_text.text: An updated analysis is reported by the CDF collaboration [7] using full statistics available.
body_text.section: Di-jet mass spectrum measurement in W + 2 jets

body_text.text: With improved calibrations of the detector response and a better understanding of the instrumental backgrounds, the standard measurements were found to be in agreement with the standard model monte carlo predictions.
body_text.section: Di-jet mass spectrum measurement in W + 2 jets

body_text.text: Motivated by the former "CDF bump", search for a di-jet resonance is carried out in W+jet events by CMS for W + 2 jet and 3 jet final states [8].
body_text.section: Di-jet mass spectrum measurement in W + 2 jets

body_text.text: The contributions of standard model processes to di-jet invariant mass is determined using an unbinned maximum-likelihood fit in the invariant mass range 40 -400 GeV, excluding the signal region, 123 -186 GeV.
body_text.section: Di-jet mass spectrum measurement in W + 2 jets

body_text.text: The difference of data from the fit, divided by the fit uncertainty (pull) is shown in Figure 9.
body_text.section: Di-jet mass spectrum measurement in W + 2 jets

body_text.text: No excess is observed, and an upper limit of 5.0 pb is set at 95% CL on the production cross section for a generic Gaussian signal with a mass about 150 GeV.
body_text.section: Di-jet mass spectrum measurement in W + 2 jets

body_text.text: Measurement of double parton scattering in W+jets
Small momentum fractions (x) carried by the incoming partons are accesible via proton-proton collisions at the LHC energies.
body_text.section: Measurement of double parton scattering in W+jets

body_text.text: The large number of partons having small momentum fractions increase the probability of two parton-parton scattering occuring at the same time and producing 2 identifiable hard scattering in proton-proton interactions.
body_text.section: Measurement of double parton scattering in W+jets

body_text.text: Double Parton Scattering (DPS) studies might provide information on spatial structure of hadrons, and provide improved understanding of backgrounds to new physics and higgs boson searches.
body_text.section: Measurement of double parton scattering in W+jets

body_text.text: DPS is investigated in events with leptonically decaying W boson and 2 jet final states [9].
body_text.section: Measurement of double parton scattering in W+jets

body_text.text: DPS events differ from the Single Parton Scattering (SPS) events due to the fact that the di-jet system from one parton interaction is independent from the W coming from the other parton interaction.
body_text.section: Measurement of double parton scattering in W+jets

body_text.text: In this study, variables sensitive to discriminate DPS from SPS events; the azimuthal angle difference between jets (Δφ( j1, j2)), the ratio of the magnitude of vectorial sum of the p T of jets to the scalar sum of p T of jets (Δ rel p T ), and the azimuthal angle between W and dijet system (ΔS ) are measured.
body_text.section: Measurement of double parton scattering in W+jets

body_text.text: In Figures 10 and 11, fully corrected differential cross sections are shown for the ΔS variable for events with exactly two jets accompanying the W boson.
body_text.section: Measurement of double parton scattering in W+jets

body_text.text: Monte Carlo predictions including DPS simulation describe the data well, whereas the simulations without DPS fails to describe the cross section and the shape of the distribution.
body_text.section: Measurement of double parton scattering in W+jets

body_text.text: This study is the first step towards extracting the underlying DPS fraction at LHC energies.
body_text.section: Measurement of double parton scattering in W+jets

body_text.text: Electroweak Z + forward-backward jets production measurement
Pure electroweak production of W and Z bosons with two well separated jets is quite sizeable at the LHC [10].
body_text.section: Electroweak Z + forward-backward jets production measurement

body_text.text: Study of these process is important especially for Higgs production from Vector Boson Fusion.
body_text.section: Electroweak Z + forward-backward jets production measurement

body_text.text: Measurements of the pure electroweak production of Z boson with two forward backward jets is carried out in ll j j final state.
body_text.section: Electroweak Z + forward-backward jets production measurement

body_text.text: To extract the small electroweak signal from the Drell Yan  Figure 11.
body_text.section: Electroweak Z + forward-backward jets production measurement

body_text.text: Fully-corrected differential cross sections for ΔS , normalised to the total cross section.
body_text.section: Electroweak Z + forward-backward jets production measurement

body_text.text: background, two different methods have been carried out.
body_text.section: Electroweak Z + forward-backward jets production measurement

body_text.text: Firstly, the signal is extracted from a fit to the m j 1 j 2 distribution.
body_text.section: Electroweak Z + forward-backward jets production measurement

body_text.text: As a cross check, a multivariate analysis technique is used, where a boosted decision tree with decorrelation (BDTD) is trained using various observables.
body_text.section: Electroweak Z + forward-backward jets production measurement

body_text.text: The signal is hence confirmed by two different approaches.
body_text.section: Electroweak Z + forward-backward jets production measurement

body_text.text: The cross section is measured as σ = 154 ± 24(stat.) ±46 (exp. syst.) ±27 (th. syst.) ±3 (lum.) fb, which is consistent with the theoretical prediction at NLO, 166 fb.
body_text.section: Electroweak Z + forward-backward jets production measurement

body_text.text: Conclusions
Measurements of various V+jet processes with CMS detector are presented in this paper.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: These measurements provide a detailed description of the topological structure of V+ jets events.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: The measurements test the validity of QCD, and provide confidence for existing Monte Carlo models in describing standard model processes.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: Some other important V+jet measurements are carried out by CMS experiment which are not covered in the talk, such as Heavy Flavour production with Vector bosons (V+HF) [11][12][13][14] that provide constraints to the heavy quark PDFs.
body_text.section: Conclusions

body_text.text: In all measurements, good agreement is observed between data and standard model Monte Carlo predictions.
body_text.section: Conclusions
